questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DIPLOMA LEVEL : BUSINESS DATA MANAGEMENT (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)
question_texts: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DIPLOMA LEVEL : BUSINESS DATA MANAGEMENT (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: What does the law of demand state?
question_texts: What does the law of demand state?

options.option_text: As the price of a good increases, the quantity demanded decreases
As the price of a good decreases, the quantity demanded decreases
As the price of a good increases, the quantity supplied decreases
As the price of a good decreases, the quantity supplied increases

questions.question_text_1: Which function would you use to count the number of cells that meet a specific condition?
question_texts: Which function would you use to count the number of cells that meet a specific condition?

questions.question_text_1: In a saturated smartphone market where 70% of current users express interest in upgrading their phones in the next two months, and the no. of new smartphone users remain unchanged, what should companies/manufacturers prioritize?
question_texts: In a saturated smartphone market where 70% of current users express interest in upgrading their phones in the next two months, and the no. of new smartphone users remain unchanged, what should companies/manufacturers prioritize?

options.option_text: Expand distribution channels to reach untapped geographic regions.
Focus on females as their target customers.
Invest in research and development to create innovative features for newcustomers.
Develop targeted upgrade incentives and promotions for current userslooking to replace their old devices

questions.question_text_1: What does the Days of Sales of Inventory indicate?
question_texts: What does the Days of Sales of Inventory indicate?

options.option_text: The average number of days required by a company to turn its inventory intosales.
The number of days when inventory is zero in a year
Total number of days when inventory sales is zero due to lack of inventory
The average number of inventory stockout days in a month

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following factors is most critical in determining the market potential for a new product ?
question_texts: Which of the following factors is most critical in determining the market potential for a new product ?

options.option_text: The size of the target market and percentage of potential customersinterested in the product.
Historical sale data of unrelated products.
Current market share of existing products.

questions.question_text_1: Which metric is most important to monitor during an A/B test?
question_texts: Which metric is most important to monitor during an A/B test?

options.option_text: Total number of users tested in the experiment
Key performance indicators (KPIs) specific to the experiment

questions.question_text_1:
Arrange the following steps while working with unstructured data in a ranking modelling: 
I. Normalizing II. Preprocessing III. Ranking IV. Composite score
question_texts:
Arrange the following steps while working with unstructured data in a ranking modelling: 
I. Normalizing II. Preprocessing III. Ranking IV. Composite score

questions.question_text_1: If a FinTech company wants to cut down losses, which of the following should they do?
question_texts: If a FinTech company wants to cut down losses, which of the following should they do?

options.option_text: Decrease approval cutoff of credit score
Increase approval cutoff of credit score

questions.question_text_1:
PayBuddy conducted an A/B test to understand if their new Funding Instrument recommendation strategy works well. Following are the details of the control and treatment groups. From the given table, which of the following statements are true? 
i. Value of Credit transactions increased with the new recommendation strategy ii. Value of Debit transactions increased with the new recommendation strategy iii. Value of both Credit and Debit transactions increased with the new recommendation strategy iv. Value of Credit transactions decreased with the new recommendation strategy v. Value of Debit transactions decreased with the new recommendation strategy

questions.question_text_1:
PePhone is a FinTech firm that processes payments. Following are sources of revenue for the company – 3.5% of transaction amount as transaction fee from merchant for all types of transactions (credit and debit), 18% p.a. interest on credit transactions and incurs a loss of credit if not paid back. Calculate the overall profit for the company based on the below table – (Assume payback of credit in a year) 
Note: Declined transactions will not get credit but customers will complete the payment through PePhone using their bank details.
questions.question_text_2:

Calculate the overall profit for the company based on the below table – (Assume payback of credit in a year) 
Note: Declined transactions will not get credit but customers will complete the payment through PePhone using their bank details.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following conditions can use the concept of "weighted average" to analyse expenditure data?
question_texts: Which of the following conditions can use the concept of "weighted average" to analyse expenditure data?

options.option_text: By considering importance of expenditure categories
By considering the population size of different regions
By adjusting for inflation over time
By analyzing the impact of income levels on expenditure

questions.question_text_1: In Excel, the SUBTOTAL function is used to perform calculations on a filtered range of data. Which of the following statements about the SUBTOTAL function is correct?
question_texts: In Excel, the SUBTOTAL function is used to perform calculations on a filtered range of data. Which of the following statements about the SUBTOTAL function is correct?

options.option_text: SUBTOTAL can only calculate the sum of a range and ignores hidden rows inthe filtered data.
SUBTOTAL can perform various calculations, including sum, average, count,and more, and it ignores rows hidden by filters.
SUBTOTAL performs calculations only on rows that are manually hidden, notthose hidden by filters.
SUBTOTAL can calculate results based on data in any worksheet, regardless ofwhether the data is visible or hidden.

props.summary:
Here’s a structured **summary of core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** for the **Business Data Management (Computer-Based Exam)** based on the question paper.
The exam covers **business analytics, data-driven decision-making, Excel functions, financial metrics, A/B testing, and operational efficiency**.

---

---

### **1. Core Topics & Concepts**
#### **A. Economics & Business Fundamentals**
1. **Law of Demand**
   - **Concept**: Inverse relationship between price and quantity demanded (all else equal).
   - **Equation**:
     \[
     Q_d = f(P^{-1}, \text{other factors})
     \]
     Where \(Q_d\) = Quantity Demanded, \(P\) = Price.

2. **Types of Goods**
   - **Normal Goods**: Demand ↑ when income ↑ (e.g., smartphones).
   - **Inferior Goods**: Demand ↓ when income ↑ (e.g., generic brands).
   - **Luxury Goods**: High income elasticity (demand ↑ more than proportionally with income).

3. **Market Potential**
   - **Key Factors**:
     - Size of target market.
     - % of potential customers interested.
   - **Equation**:
     \[
     \text{Market Potential} = \text{Target Market Size} \times \text{% Interested}
     \]

4. **Revenue & Profit Calculations**
   - **Total Revenue (TR)**:
     \[
     TR = \text{Price per Unit} \times \text{Quantity Sold}
     \]
   - **Profit**:
     \[
     \text{Profit} = \text{Revenue} - \text{Costs} - \text{Losses (e.g., defaults)}
     \]
   - **Example (Q11)**:
     - Transaction fee = 3.5% of transaction amount.
     - Interest on credit = 18% p.a. (if paid back).
     - Loss if defaulted.

5. **Percentage Change in Revenue**
   - **Formula**:
     \[
     \% \text{ Change} = \left( \frac{\text{New Revenue} - \text{Old Revenue}}{\text{Old Revenue}} \right) \times 100
     \]
   - **Example (Q14)**:
     - Income ↑ from Rs 15,000 → Rs 25,000.
     - Quantity demanded ↑ from 60 → 90 units.
     - Price ↓ from Rs 40 → Rs 38.

---

#### **B. Data Analysis & Excel Functions**
1. **Excel Functions**
   - **COUNTIF**: Counts cells meeting a condition.
     ```excel
     =COUNTIF(range, criteria)
     ```
   - **SUBTOTAL**: Performs calculations (sum, avg, count) on filtered data.
     ```excel
     =SUBTOTAL(function_num, range)
     ```
     - Ignores hidden rows (useful for dynamic dashboards).

2. **Weighted Average**
   - **Use Cases**:
     - Importance of expenditure categories (Q12).
     - Population size of regions.
   - **Formula**:
     \[
     \text{Weighted Avg} = \sum (w_i \times x_i)
     \]
     Where \(w_i\) = weight, \(x_i\) = value.

3. **Days Sales of Inventory (DSI)**
   - **Purpose**: Measures average days to turn inventory into sales.
   - **Formula**:
     \[
     DSI = \frac{\text{Average Inventory}}{\text{Cost of Goods Sold}} \times \text{Number of Days}
     \]

---

#### **C. A/B Testing & Experimentation**
1. **Key Metrics**
   - **Primary KPI**: Conversion rate, revenue per user, or engagement (Q7).
   - **Statistical Significance**: Ensure results are not due to randomness.

2. **Interpreting Results (Q10)**
   - Compare **treatment (new strategy)** vs. **control (old strategy)**.
   - Example:
     | Group      | Avg Credit Txn | Avg Debit Txn |
     |------------|----------------|---------------|
     | Treatment  | $1725          | $2780         |
     | Control    | $1810          | $2679         |
   - **Conclusion**:
     - Credit transactions ↓ (Treatment < Control).
     - Debit transactions ↑ (Treatment > Control).

---

#### **D. Operational Efficiency (OEE)**
1. **Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE)**
   - **Components**:
     - **Availability**: % of time equipment is operational.
       \[
       \text{Availability} = \frac{\text{Operating Time}}{\text{Planned Production Time}} \times 100
       \]
     - **Performance**: % of maximum speed achieved.
       \[
       \text{Performance} = \frac{\text{Actual Output}}{\text{Theoretical Output}} \times 100
       \]
     - **Quality**: % of good units produced.
       \[
       \text{Quality} = \frac{\text{Good Units}}{\text{Total Units}} \times 100
       \]
   - **OEE Formula**:
     \[
     OEE = \text{Availability} \times \text{Performance} \times \text{Quality}
     \]
   - **Example (Q19–22)**:
     - Planned time = 8 hrs, Lost time (X1) = 1 hr.
     - Actual speed (X2) = 180 units/hr, Design speed = 200 units/hr.
     - Good units = 1050 → Quality (X3) = 83.33%.
     - OEE (X4) = 87.5% × 90% × 83.33% ≈ 65.6%.

---

#### **E. Business Strategy**
1. **Market Saturation (Q4)**
   - **Strategy**: Prioritize **upgrade incentives** for existing users (vs. expanding to new regions).

2. **Risk Management (Q9)**
   - **FinTech Example**: Increase **credit score cutoff** to reduce defaults.

3. **Sales Trends (Q17)**
   - Identify products with **continuously increasing sales** (e.g., Widget C).

4. **Revenue Contribution (Q18)**
   - Calculate % revenue by category (e.g., Widgets contribute 30.1%).

---

#### **F. HR & Recruitment (Q23–25)**
1. **Terminology**:
   - **Indent**: HR form for budget/skills required.
   - **Employee Referral**: Sourcing talent via existing employees.
   - **Appraisal**: Evaluating employee performance.

---

---

### **2. Mermaid Knowledge Graphs**
#### **Graph 1: Economics & Revenue**
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Economics Fundamentals] --> B[Law of Demand]
    A --> C[Types of Goods]
    C --> C1[Normal Goods]
    C --> C2[Inferior Goods]
    C --> C3[Luxury Goods]
    A --> D[Market Potential]
    D --> D1[Target Market Size]
    D --> D2[Customer Interest %]
    A --> E[Revenue & Profit]
    E --> E1[Total Revenue]
    E --> E2[Profit Calculation]
    E --> E3[Percentage Change]
```

#### **Graph 2: Data Analysis & Excel**
```mermaid
graph TD
    F[Data Analysis] --> G[Excel Functions]
    G --> G1[COUNTIF]
    G --> G2[SUBTOTAL]
    F --> H[Weighted Average]
    H --> H1[Expenditure Categories]
    H --> H2[Population Size]
    F --> I[Inventory Metrics]
    I --> I1[Days Sales of Inventory]
```

#### **Graph 3: A/B Testing & Experiments**
```mermaid
graph TD
    J[A/B Testing] --> K[Key Metrics]
    K --> K1[Conversion Rate]
    K --> K2[Revenue per User]
    J --> L[Interpretation]
    L --> L1[Treatment vs Control]
    L --> L2[Statistical Significance]
```

#### **Graph 4: Operational Efficiency**
```mermaid
graph TD
    M[OEE] --> N[Availability]
    M --> O[Performance]
    M --> P[Quality]
    N --> N1[Operating Time]
    O --> O1[Actual vs Theoretical Output]
    P --> P1[Good Units %]
    M --> Q[OEE Calculation]
```

#### **Graph 5: Business Strategy**
```mermaid
graph TD
    R[Business Strategy] --> S[Market Saturation]
    S --> S1[Upgrade Incentives]
    R --> T[Risk Management]
    T --> T1[Credit Score Cutoff]
    R --> U[Sales Trends]
    U --> U1[Increasing/Decreasing Patterns]
    R --> V[Revenue Contribution]
    V --> V1[Category-wise %]
```

#### **Graph 6: HR Processes**
```mermaid
graph TD
    W[HR] --> X[Indent]
    X --> X1[Budget/Skills Form]
    W --> Y[Employee Referral]
    Y --> Y1[Talent Sourcing]
    W --> Z[Appraisal]
    Z --> Z1[Performance Evaluation]
```

---
---

### **3. Key Equations Summary**
| **Topic**               | **Equation**                                                                 | **Example Question** |
|-------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------|
| Law of Demand           | \(Q_d = f(P^{-1})\)                                                       | Q2                   |
| Market Potential        | \(\text{Market Potential} = \text{Target Size} \times \text{% Interested}\) | Q6                   |
| Total Revenue           | \(TR = P \times Q\)                                                        | Q14, Q16             |
| Profit                  | \(\text{Profit} = \text{Revenue} - \text{Costs} - \text{Losses}\)        | Q11                  |
| % Change in Revenue     | \(\% \Delta = \left( \frac{\text{New} - \text{Old}}{\text{Old}} \right) \times 100\) | Q14          |
| Weighted Average        | \(\sum (w_i \times x_i)\)                                                  | Q12                  |
| Days Sales of Inventory | \(DSI = \frac{\text{Average Inventory}}{\text{COGS}} \times \text{Days}\) | Q5                   |
| OEE                     | \(OEE = \text{Availability} \times \text{Performance} \times \text{Quality}\) | Q19–22           |
| A/B Test Interpretation | Compare treatment vs. control metrics                                      | Q7, Q10              |
